text: [Music]
hello this is chef john from food wishes
calm with gingerbread whoopie pies
that's right we're doing a gingery
holiday take on this very old American
classic and his legend has it when this
was invented the first people that
tasted it were so taken with its
deliciousness that they ran around
Yellin whoopee whoopee of course they
were burned as witches but happily the
name caught on and survives to this day
so let me show you how to make these
four step one we're gonna get our dry
ingredients together which is white
all-purpose flour some baking soda
please don't use powder some salt lots
of ginger some cinnamon some white sugar
and some dark and mysterious molasses
and by the way that's not the brand
those are just adjectives we're also
gonna add some vegetable oil and one
large egg all right we're gonna mix that
together and it's gonna be very stiff
and for some reason I started using a
whisk which really wasn't the best tool
so I'm switching to a spatula and I'm
gonna mash that all together until it
looks like that and at that point we're
gonna pour over some boiling water and
that's gonna soften this up
significantly it's gonna turn that kind
of dry stiff dough into a smooth soft
batter and that's really what we're
looking for
technically we're actually making little
tiny cakes not cookies so while this is
a pie it's actually a cookie made from
two cakes is everyone clear on that and
for some reason I still have the spatula
in my hands let me switch to the whisk
to make sure we have no lumps and by the
way why do people get so amused when I
switch utensils you got a mitt it's a
little odd all right so once that's
mixed completely smooth we are ready to
pan these up so I'm going to use a
silicone mat lined baking sheet and I'm
using my 1 ounce I believe it is sorbet
scoop or you can of course just use
rounded tablespoons I'm just gonna bake
12 which is gonna make 6 finished
whoopie pies all right if you need some
help with a spoon to make these
perfectly round go ahead and because
this batter is kind of thin do not under
any circumstances give them the old hole
tap etapa just put them straight into a
preheated 350 degree oven for about 12
minutes or until they look like this
okay now what you're gonna want to do is
let these cool on the pan for about 15
minutes until you can handle them
without them breaking and then I like to
transfer them onto a rack too
cooling all the way you cannot stuff
your whoopie pies while they're warm all
right so while those are cooling I'm
gonna go ahead and make my cream-cheese
filling so in a bowl I have some room
temperature cream cheese a little splash
of milk or cream some vanilla extract
some powdered sugar of course and a
little chunk of butter and of course any
time you're working with powdered sugar
you're gonna want to start the mixer off
very slowly otherwise you'll be wearing
this stuff and you look like one of
those kabuki dancers but anyway be
careful start off slow and then when it
starts coming together turn it to high
and whip that until it's very light and
fluffy something like that and then
you've probably figured out the next
step you're gonna take one of your
gingerbread cookies slash little mini
cakes
you're gonna pipe and or spoon some of

that is a gingerbread whoopie pie very

we go
and once those are all filled I'm gonna

bad you can eat these as is but they are

and by the way if you're looking for a
very excellent pairing
may I suggest beer it goes with
